meanings.definition: Exhausted from too much work or activity.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, Sarah felt overtire and needed to rest.
meanings.sent2: The children were overtire after playing outside all day.
meanings.sent3: Even the energetic puppy looked overtire after chasing its tail for hours.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner's legs felt overtire, like they were made of lead.
meanings.sent5: The students were overtire after studying for their exams late into the night.

meanings.sent1: Don't overtire yourself by working too hard without breaks.
meanings.sent2: The coach warned the players not to overtire before the big game.
meanings.sent3: I tend to overtire my phone battery by using too many apps at once.
meanings.sent4: The chef didn't want to overtire the dough, so he kneaded it gently.
meanings.sent5: It's easy to overtire your muscles if you lift weights that are too heavy.
